meanings.definition: Relating to the electrical activity of living cells.
meanings.sent1: The electrophysiologic changes in the heart can be detected with special equipment.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use electrophysiologic tests to understand how nerves work in the body.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's electrophysiologic experiments on frogs made them jump around in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: Her brain felt like an electrophysiologic storm during the intense lightning storm.
meanings.sent5: The glowing jellyfish displayed an electrophysiologic dance of light in the dark ocean.

meanings.definition: Involving the study of electrical signals in the body.
meanings.sent1: The electrophysiologic research team discovered new ways to measure brain activity.
meanings.sent2: Hospitals often use electrophysiologic techniques to diagnose nerve disorders.
meanings.sent3: The detective's electrophysiologic investigation into the crime scene revealed shocking evidence.
meanings.sent4: The city at night was an electrophysiologic wonderland of flashing neon lights.
meanings.sent5: The concert hall was filled with an electrophysiologic buzz as the music played.
